gov.usgs.anss.metadata

Class MetaData

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.edgethread.EdgeThread
        • gov.usgs.anss.metadata.MetaData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class MetaData
extends EdgeThread
    This class is the thread that manages the metadata in memory cache of the data. It use the channelmeta, channelepoch, response tables to put data into the various places it needs it. It uses SubThreads to periodically renew this data. The database access uses the "readonly" cached and encrypted credential from the account where the job is run.

    This class is always started from the MetaDataServer and which passes in the command line arguments. 

     -upddatems nnnnn  Sets the update from the database interval in milliseconds (def=every 6 hours)

                                                                double mindeg,

                                                                double lat,
                                                                double lng)
        return a list of channels matching a regular expression
        Parameters:
        re - The matching regular expression
        mindeg - Minimum number of degrees from tht lat and long
        within - The number of degrees of the with circle
        lat - THe latitude of the center of the delaz circle
        lng - The longitude of the center of the delaz circle
        Returns:
        A ArrayList of MetaChannels which match

      • getChannel

        public MetaChannel getChannel(java.lang.String seedname)
        Get a MetaChan with the data for this channel. This uses a cache of the previously requested channels in order to keep the lookups fairly short
        Parameters:
        seedname - The 12 character seed name for this channel
        Returns:
        The MetaChannel with this data

      • getChannel

        public ChannelEpoch getChannel(java.lang.String seedname,
                               java.sql.Timestamp eff)
        Get a MetaChan with the data for this channel. This uses a cache of the previously requested channels in order to keep the lookups fairly short
        Parameters:
        seedname - The 12 character seed name for this channel
        eff - The date/time at which the epoch is desired
        Returns:
        null if no epoch is found for the channel containing the time or if the channel is not found at all, else the epoch

      • getStationEpochs

        public java.util.ArrayList<Station> getStationEpochs(java.lang.String station,
                                                     java.sql.Timestamp eff,
                                                     java.sql.Timestamp end)
        get the station records for the given station and time range, This uses a cache of the previously requested stations in order to keep the lookups fairly short.
        Parameters:
        station - The 7 character max station name with network code
        eff - The date which this station records is desired
        end - The ending date range for which station information is desired
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of Station> of matching epochs

      • getStation

        public Station getStation(java.lang.String station,
                          java.sql.Timestamp eff)
        get the station record for the given station and time, This uses a cache of the previously requested stations in order to keep the lookups fairly short.
        Parameters:
        station - The 7 character max station name with network code
        eff - The date which this station records is desired
        Returns:
        the station record matching this station name and effective date
